title: Make Karthus's ult ignores spell-shields

I wrote this in another thread:

 If we have to suffer the EoN...

Here is an idea that I have been rolling around about Karth...

What if...

Karth's ult wasnt a channel into a big nasty burst, but instead was divided into 3 verses. During his 3 second channel he applies stacks of "Verse of Requiem" to a target, about 1 per second. At the end of the channel you take damage based on how many verses (stacks) you have. Activating a spell shield, or having a banshees means you will still potentially have 2 stacks giving Karthus some damage for his ult. This would work because theoreticly the application of one of the stacks would pop the shield.

Down side is it will reduce the overall counter play to his ult as the only way to dodge the damage without stasis would be to be Sivir, with a banshees vail, EoN, and a Morgana Black shield on hand... or be swallowed by Tahm, or hit with Bards Tempered Fate (which is still stasis).

Upside is Karth can still do some damage against spell shielded enemies, and it would add a little bit of the idea of "singing" to the "Deathsinger" champ.

Any thoughts?

Night's edge won't be able to be used to block Karthus unless it wouldn't have done anything in the first place. 

**Stop whining and read what the item actually does.**

It gets canceled by any hostile effect or action related to you, from attacking to being attacked. Effectively, you can only start it out-of-combat, where you wouldn't be using your ult on someone anyway. 

It is not an on-demand spell-shield. Its an engage tool for assassins.
The complain is about karthus not being able to finish a fleeing enemy at the safety of the space behind his turret by simply pressing R.

If they have Edge of Night and didn't use it as someone was moving into engage on them, or before engaging on someone, there's still something wrong, though. 

If they saved it for Karthus, that's entirely fair.
Totally agree with you in this topic, just wanted to clear up the case here. ^^
yeah because screw counterplay
His Ult has more counterplay than most Ults in the game at this point, let's cut him some slack.
By a select few champions. That isn't "counterplay".

Exactly. What people are mentioning here is not counterplay.
It is counterbuilding or just counterpicking.

Counterplay is something you do actively to prevent something else to happen.
So yes, there is counterplay for Karthus' Ult.
Don't get low. Ever. Don't dare to fight if you are not sure you will survive the fight with at least 50% health.
It isn't healthy counterplay though.
You can also CC him while he's channeling (provided he's still alive), but a good Karthus will never let that happen.

If I was the Karthus player, I wouldn't mind if I saw my opponent's building this. It just mean's I'm actually a threat, and I'm in fact forcing them to deviate from their desired build path. And besides, I still have the ability to bait the spell shield out, or the shield could be taken out by another spell entirely. (Yes it counter's the ult, but even the counterplay has counterplay) 

Also, as someone who does play Karthus, I would find it incredibly short sided to say this item completely counters his ult. (as it seems like you measure his ult by it's ability to execute) His ult affects the entire enemy team. Buying this item for yourself will only counter 1/5 of his ult. But it would still be effective at damaging the rest of your team. (especially since the MR aura is going)
